Events that occurred on 23 March.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1917 - Voice actor Hans Conried is born.
1952 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 132a.
1954 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 143b.
1963 - Mr. and Mrs. Kloos write a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien.
1994 - Donald Swann, composer of The Road Goes Ever On, dies.
2003 - The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers wins two Oscars, out of six nominations, at the 75th Academy Awards.
2006 - The Lord of the Rings (musical) opens in Toronto.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 2510:
Borondir is on his way in search of the Éothéod.
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf arrives in Mirkwood and begins the questioning of Gollum.
T.A. 3019:
The Host of the West marches towards the Black Gate. They pass out of Ithilien. Aragorn dismisses the faint-hearted.
Frodo and Sam leave behind their arms and gear.
